intro: Lagetta pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered lagetta, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually yellow or pale green, and it produces small, hairy seeds. Lagetta pauciflora is often found in coastal areas and is considered a rare and specialized species.
